catalog_info.title: Major Issues in the Study of Japanese Religions
catalog_info.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 3961.
catalog_info.description: This seminar is primarily for graduate students preparing for research and teaching in Japanese religions.  Because it will have a different focus each time it is offered, students may take it more than once.  The topic for Fall 2015 will be ethnographic studies of Shinto.  Future offerings of the course will focus on such topics as shrine festivals (matsuri), religion in the Japanese empire, and Japanese new religious movements.  Most readings will be in English, but Japanese-language readings will also be included.
